channel.title: I have a bunch of... (help needed)
channel.description: ... futurama episodes on my computer. My mom makes me limit my computer time, but not really TV time, so I want to put them on DVDs. I am not sure if my drive can burn Dvds :) how can I check? Also, what format would be the [u]best[/u] to save them as so I could play them on my DVD player. Also, I tried draging and dropping the files into my D: drive and it said I couldn't

item.title: I have a bunch of... (help needed)
item.dc:creator: @itachi_uchia itachi uchia
item.description:
@itachi_uchia wrote:

Hmm,

Go to http://www.downloads.com
Then type in “i tunes”

Then download Itunes and use it.

It bruns,plays,organizes and does other stuff with you’r music/videos.It uses vids and tv show ephisodes.So then you can burn it onto a disk.

Buy disks you can burn stuff on at your software store.I’d choose a software store because online it’s risky.I mean you don’t wana accidently buy a porno DVD.If you’r mom sees that your fucked lol.

Or do you…? LOL JK

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @mrrules mrrules
item.description:
@mrrules wrote:

Yeah you can burn cd’s with your computer…Or if u had a flash drive save them on there and plug the flash drive into your 360 and go to media and click the flash drive and watch the movie on your tv.

item.title: I have a bunch of... (help needed)
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

bobby:

OK I have nero smartstart, that is crap right?

If you have Nero SmartStart, you might have Nero Vision. If you do, open it up (Start>All Programs>Nero 7 ***[where *** is Premium or Ultra]> Photo and Video>Nero Vision) and the rest should be self-explanatory

Read full topic
item.source: I have a bunch of... (help needed)

item.title: I have a bunch of... (help needed)
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Nero isn’t bad…but it depends what format these episodes are in. If they are divx/xvid encoded or ogm, your dvd player may not be able to reply them. However, chances are it will be able to play mpegs.

Read full topic

item.title: I have a bunch of... (help needed)
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Right click your D: drive and click properties and then go to the hardware tab and it will tell you what kind of drive you have. Download a burner like Alcohol 120% if you end up having a DVD R/W.

Read full topic
